attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look at the NHS provision of care.
attributes.background: It is clear the politicians and clinicians are unable to decide what the tax pound should be spent on in the NHS.  The impasse can only be broken by a Royal Commission looking at the NHS. Only a Royal Commission can decide what the NHS,  in EU parlance, 'should', 'shall' and 'should not' provide.

attributes.action: Reveal how many detainees reported being sexually assaulted/raped in Yarl’s Wood
attributes.background: In response to a Freedom of Information request, The Home Office refused to reveal how many detainees have been sexually assaulted or raped inside Yarl’s Wood on the grounds that “disclosure would, or would be likely to, prejudice the commercial interests” of people involved with running Yarl’s Wood
attributes.additional_details:
The Independent submitted the FOI because many reports of sexual assault & abuse have been made against staff at Yarl’s Wood. Chief prisons inspector Nick Hardwick called the centre  a “place of national concern”. The UN’s special rapporteur on violence against women, Rashida Manjoo said she'd been refused entry to the centre by the Government
The Immigration Minister & Home Secretary must reveal the numbers, & stop putting the commercial interests of Serco above human rights of vulnerable people

attributes.action: Veterans injury compensation to be protected and disregarded for benefits!!
attributes.background:
If a veteran recieves compensation as a result of an injury caused whilst serving our country - i believe it should be protected and disregarded for benefit entitlement.
Recieving compensation shouldn't effect a veteran claiming benefits inc ESA, JSA and housing when they return to civilian life.
attributes.additional_details:
At present compensation is classed as savings. If a veteran recieves over £6,000, their entitlement to benefit may be affected  (reduced). If a veteran recieves more than £16,000 then they may not be entitled to the benefit at all. 

Veterans should be able to choose how they use their compensaton, and not be turned away for benefits and expected to live off it!

Help protect our veterans and their compensaton by signing my petition in support, thankyou :)

attributes.action: Fund Cancer Research and table global funding with world leaders. Global killer.
attributes.background: Cancer is a global killer, Get a ring-fenced UK fund of Cancer Research and table funding on the world political stage. Too many people are lost to this terrible disease. More should be done. Please support
attributes.additional_details: My 8yr old is raising funds for a cancer hospice after the tragic loss of his Grandfather to cancer.  He is selfless and what he said to his father is amazing.. bit.ly/oliversmission  We are losing to many people to cancer - Bowie, Rickman, Guinness, Swayze, Newman, Wayne, MQueen, Hopper, Sinatra, Cushing, Landon, Cole, Thaw and thousands of ordinary people never published, but missed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pet shops to sell animals which are not spayed or neutered
attributes.background: Pet shops have no responsibility of preventing their pets from being sold on to someone who can breed them, make money from them and sell the offspring onto whoever they like. This can often Lead to pets in the wrong hands, with inexperienced handlers and put pressure on animal rescue centres.
attributes.additional_details:
Most uk pet stores claim to be responsible by taking information of their customers and giving basic advice of animal care but they rarely follow it up. By making sure the animals are spayed or neutered before the day of sale will ensure the safety of those pets and its further offspring. 

(its not to say that the store should pay for the treatment but should offer a scheme towards it)

attributes.action: Ban the making and receiving of all phone calls whilst driving.
attributes.background: Cars kill. Research clearly shows a person is distracted from driving and their reaction times are slowed if on the phone, even if they are using it hands-free. No phone call is worth a distraction that could cause death. Help save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence shows making and receiving calls distracts drivers and slows their reaction times. A caller can always leave a message and call or be called back. If it is important they will be in touch.
 
Radio 5 live programme ( starts 8.30 mins) 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07dj0zj

attributes.action: Reduce the retirement age for workers in physical jobs.
attributes.background: In physical jobs people's bodies don't last to the new and ever increasing retirement age. Builders, postmen, farm workers are just a few examples. In my Job (postal industry) workers have worn out joints and limbs after a relitvly short time in the industry. Some will retire almost crippled.

attributes.action: To add a 6 month get out clause to every privately rented housing contract.
attributes.background: Privately rented tenancys are increasingly 24 months with a 'no get out' clause resulting in massive financial loss and stress to private renters. Regardless of reason, be it issues with the property or change in personal circumstances, the right to move must protect human rights.
attributes.additional_details: I have support from the housing charity 'Shelter' and facts and alarming figures of private renters in need.

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) (electroshock) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress. Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent. Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm. Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org @soapgroup

attributes.action: Pressure public establishments to provide baby changing facilities for men.
attributes.background:
There are still many public facilities where child changing facilities are either housed in the ladies toilets or simply not available to men at all. 
We urge the government to pressure businesses of all sizes to ensure men have equal opportunity to access changing facilities for their children.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing Rabbits
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Reduce state pension age for construction workers
attributes.background: I,ve been an electrician in construction since i was 16 and constantly hear about many colleagues having very little or, no retirement due to ill health caused by the exposure to chemicals, asbestos etc.  and the physical toll to our bodies, especially joints, due to the nature of our work. Help us.
attributes.additional_details: There are many life expectancy studies, relating to all occupations , that will back up this petition and the HSE will confirm the occupational hazards and illnesses, that construction workers are exposed to on a daily basis. The studies do vary with data suggesting that construction workers die between 6  to 10 years earlier than people in white collar office occupations. Construction workers morally deserve a period of rest,  just as much as other workers do, at the end of our shorter lives.

attributes.action: Make labelling of Palm oil products mandatory to show sustainability of source
attributes.background:
I would like the law to be changed, to require products containing palm oil to carry labels which show whether or not the palm oil has been produced sustainably. We have the leaping bunny for guiding the consumer as to an animal testing free symbol and recycling symbols.

http://www.rspo.org/about
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/oct/26/palm-oil-industry-consumer-understanding-sustainability-cspo-packaging-marks-spencer-boots-ecover

attributes.action: Declare the result of the EU referendum null & void.
attributes.background: Voters may have been influenced by false information sent to them by the Vote Leave campaign, whose campaign  leaflet claimed that the cost of UK membership of the EU is £350M per week, which is false.
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/cameron-bbcqt-eu-referendum-special-myths/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36014941

attributes.action: Flash glucose monitoring systems to be available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Flash glucose monitoring system the next best thing to a cgm. 
Flash Glucose Monitoring is a much cheaper and alternative way to check your sugars, insert a sensor into the arm/leg and scan away why prick when you can scan.
attributes.additional_details:
The system does not require fingerstick calibration, so users can dose insulin based on its readings (except for when hypoglycemic, when glucose levels are rapidly changing, or when symptoms don’t match the system’s readings). 

The sensor can be worn for 14 days at a time, and has shown better control and much cheaper then testing with strips.

attributes.action: Educate all health professionals and teachers on Autism!!
attributes.background: Autism is a condition that not many people are aware of unless they have experience of it, as a result people with this condition are becoming more socially excluded in everyday life. People with the condition face constant battles and are misunderstood and judged due to the lack of education.

attributes.action: Declare the actions of Daesh against minorities as genocide
attributes.background: Daesh is committing genocide against those who do not subscribe to their mis-interpretation of Islam. Notably against the minority: Christians, Yezidi, Turkmen, Shabak, Kurds & Shia. The UK must follow the example of the European Parliament and formally acknowledge the genocide, so it can be stopped

attributes.action: Improve air quality & tackle climate change by promoting shale gas & renewables
attributes.background: Around 30% of UK electricity is still generated by burning coal, releasing large quantities of climate changing CO2 emissions and air pollutants. Government can change this by promoting a shale gas and renewables boom, avoiding 'technology tribalism' and helping secure our clean energy future.
attributes.additional_details:
Coal-fired power generation in the United States has fallen to its lowest level since 1949 as a result of a shale gas and renewables boom. It's helped to reduce climate changing CO2 emissions by a massive 32%

The UK Government can create the conditions for us to repeat this success by designating wind, solar, shale gas, biogas and waste-to-energy as Nationally Significant Infrastructure Projects, helping to cut planning red-tape, improve investor certainty and get more capacity built.

attributes.action: Let 92 yr old Myrtle Cothill remain in the UK with her daughter for her care
attributes.background: H.O.decision to deport 92-year-old who wants to spend her last days with her only child in Britain,she is independent from the state with £300 a month pension.
attributes.additional_details: She has an enlarged heart, suffers poor hearing and has lost the sight in one eye because of macular degeneration, but neither her condition nor her advanced age is enough to secure her the comfort of life with her daughter.She has been in Dorset since February 2014 and made an application to the Home Office for leave to remain the country as an adult dependent on human rights grounds.“Myrtle is dependent on both the emotional and physical care of her daughter

attributes.action: Stop Michael Fallon from spending £642m on Trident before a vote in Parliament.
attributes.background: Defence Secretary, Michael Fallon, is due to announce spending £642 million of public money on renewing Trident despite the fact that the issue of whether to replace the UK's nuclear weapons will not be voted on in Parliament until later this year.
attributes.additional_details:
Spending this money on Trident will make it more difficult for the UK to pull out of its nuclear weapon programme as a significant amount of money will already have been invested in its renewal.

This is a unilateral and undemocratic decision by the Defence Secretary that will contribute to the vote in Parliament later this year swinging in favour of renewing the weapons, compromising the impartiality of such a vote. No spending on the programme should be allowed until the vote has taken place.

attributes.action: Launch an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's Junior Doctor contract & 7day NHS plan
attributes.background: The Health Secretary has misrepresented data to claim a non-existent weekend mortality effect. The Public Accounts committee says his 7-day NHS plan is unfunded. His proposed contract has alienated a generation of doctors. We demand an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's actions and their consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Public Accounts Committee report: http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/commons-select/public-accounts-committee/news-parliament-2015/nhs-staff-numbers-report-published-15-16/

Studies demonstrate Hunt's purported weekend effect - the basis for imposing his Junior Doctor contract - does not exist: http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/06/fewer-die-in-hospital-weekends-study-jeremy-hunt-doctors-contract

attributes.action: Make mental health awareness compulsory in the national curriculum
attributes.background: We would like Mental Health studies to be compulsory in the secondary schools, to raise awareness. This will help students be supportive of everyone with mental health issues, and understand how to help someone such as their friend or family member.
attributes.additional_details:
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/MHcampaign/

(Disclaimer- the facebook page was not set up by me)

attributes.action: Get Southern trains contract cancelled in the South East
attributes.background: Tired of the excuses and the prices paid for train services on these routes only to have trains cancelled, constantly late and you cannot even get a refund on days Southern did not even have a train running all day. Let us get Southern's contract cancelled as soon as possible!

attributes.action: Make the BBC declare an interest when broadcasting on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: When directors of companies or MP's are involved in decision making where they have any financial or commercial interest, they are duty bound to declare that interest. The BBC coverage of the EU referendum  can be seen as biased as they receive a grant from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: BBC has received £2m in EU funding in run up to referendum, fuelling accusations of bias. (source Daily Telegraph)

attributes.action: End gvt. contracts to companies which avoid UK tax, or advise on tax avoidance
attributes.background: Many large corporations are benefitting from huge government contracts, grants & subsidies while avoiding corporation tax in the UK. The law should prevent the award of government contracts or funds to companies that do not pay tax on ALL their UK income, or to companies that advise on tax avoidance
attributes.additional_details: Many companies - including those running publicly-funded services - do not pay tax on the money they make in the UK, though their businesses & employees depend on the services & infrastructure paid for by UK taxpayers. Meanwhile large accountancy & management consultancy firms benefit from lucrative government contracts while also advising clients on how to avoid paying tax. Public money - grants subsidies & contracts - should not be awarded to tax-avoiding companies or those advising them.

attributes.action: Keep the ban on neonics to protect the bees!
attributes.background: Despite the fact that bee-endangering pesticides are banned in the EU, the UK government just gave the go-ahead to farmers to sow these toxic-coated seeds anyway. Any day now, Bayer and Syngenta's toxic bee-harming seeds could be sown.
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of listening to us, the Government listened to the intensive farming industry - ignoring the growing evidence of how dangerous these chemicals are to bees and other pollinators.

Hundreds of thousands of people have already signed other petitions to the UK Government to stop harming our bees, and they're feeling the sting. A massive public outcry could force the government to back down and protect bees.

attributes.action: Increase quality control on developers of new-build properties
attributes.background: House builders  are throwing up houses at a rate of knots in order to maximise return and as a result overlooking basic quality control measures. Contracts are being issued that allow them to rectify all defects post completion and thus letting them remain until legal completion
attributes.additional_details:
REFERENCES:
http://www.theguardian.com/money/2015/nov/15/new-build-home-affordable-housing-industry-compromising-quality

http://www.new-home-blog.co.uk/the-day-taylor-wimpey-ruined-my-life/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2950799/Cracks-walls-no-loft-insulation-3-000-kitchen-worktop-doesn-t-fit-Homeowner-finds-140-problems-brand-new-580-000-house-sets-Twitter-account-list-them.html

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for those who murder children.
attributes.background: All to often children's live's are being taken from the same people who are meant to raise them. This petition is calling for the execution of these murderers, if not becoming a deterrent at least it will serve as justice for the children who never got a chance.

attributes.action: Re thinking the budget for Essex Police to save PCSO s jobs
attributes.background: Essex police are having to restructure front line policing due to the amount of money they receive from government. Essex is a major county with big links and easy access to London. Losing PCSO'S from the front line due to budget constraints in the current climate is wrong. Help increase budget

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to send the brightest and best international students home
attributes.background: New Immigration Rules (HC877) require students to return home if they secure a work placement year or perform better than expected and are upgraded (e.g. BEng to MEng). This is penalising the brightest and best, it is unfair and damages the UK's reputation. This decision should be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 08/04/2016, the UK Council for International Student Affairs received the following:
"A student who needs more time to complete a course can only apply for further leave to do this if they meet one of the exemptions set out in 120A(a).  A student who undertakes a work placement would be changing their course and would therefore need to apply from overseas if they wanted to extend their leave to complete their (new) course."
The explanatory memorandum to HC877 does not detail this consequence.

attributes.action: No longer allow letting agents to discriminate against 'dss'
attributes.background: I am disabled due to a stroke and receive housing Benefits to top up the wage I earn.  Letting agents are allowed to discriminate against this, regardless of circumstance. It harks back to the time when people were allowed to discriminate against skin colour and nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Where your funds come from should make no difference, housing benefit can be more reliable than wages in that you can't be fired! I have rented receiving benefits as a single person, a single mother, part of a couple and now as a disabled parent. I have always been discriminated against. Let's make this change and not victimise the most vulnerable of our society. Let's not be those people.

attributes.action: Stop housing asylum seekers at airport hotels
attributes.background: 300 plus asylum seekers have been housed at Britannia airport hotel close to Manchester airport  a major British airport local residents find this unacceptable and unsafe since Brussels airport bombings

attributes.action: council tax should be free for people who get benefits we want to change that
attributes.background: Council tax should be free for people who gets benefits people can't afford to pay there council tax

attributes.action: If the Planning Inspector refuses a planning application the decision is final.
attributes.background:
Housing comes first, then infrastructure. In Watton it seems that this is not the case.  Facilities are not in line with the houses being built.     

We are totally powerless.  Legislation seems to be in favour of Developers/Land Speculators who are unfamiliar with the area.
attributes.additional_details: As the Community Action Group (What Watton Wants) was setup last year, when the Market Town of Watton in Norfolk was being swamped by over-development.  Watton wants sustainable development with the necessary infrastructure being put in place to support the increase of properties, people and vehicles.  This includes schools, doctors, leisure facilities, drainage, services, commuter links and employment opportunities.  Housing also needs to satisfy local people.

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for failing to provide driver details under s172 RTA 1988
attributes.background:
Failing to provide details of a driver involved in an offence is 6pts and £1000.  This can be exploited where the offence alleged carries a higher penalty than that above (e.g. dangerous driving).
The penalty for failing to provide should match that of the offence allegedly committed by the driver.
attributes.additional_details:
An example is this case: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-nottinghamshire-35472617.  A driver deliberately hit a cyclist and drive off.  There were two possible drivers and they simply refused to say who was driving.  This is not uncommon but it is effectively 
The penalty was 6pts and £150.  If the s172 penalty matched the index offence then witholding driver details would cease to be an attractive option.
Alternatively, s172 could carry custody where it is wilfully committed.

attributes.action: Please make it LAW to Scan all animals on a regular basis at the vets
attributes.background:
Currently in the UK they're are no laws with dogs/cats/animals getting scanned on a regular basis when they visit the vets. 
There is very sadly a big problem in the UK with dogs/cats getting stolen or going missing. Please Sign & Share to help this happen. 
Shocking that it is not law already.
attributes.additional_details:
All vets need to scan on new appointments, and scan on a regular basis. The Microchip can also disappear or move.
Some people find them and do not hand them in to the right authorities(dog warden etc) like it is law to do. 
My personal experience in the past each time my dogs have been scanned I have had to request it. This should not be the case.
Luckily I did that, as if my dog did go missing I would of never of got him back as his chip vanished. Dogs have a chip for a REASON
Dogs' are Family

attributes.action: Reform the IR35 Tax Regulations introduced in 2000.
attributes.background: The IR35 Regulations, introduced in 2000 to address the differences in liabilities due to HMRC between an employee and a self-employed freelance contractor providing services under a limited company, is a highly subjective, unclear and disproportionate piece of legislation that should be amended.
attributes.additional_details:
Specific reforms sought are:

Absolute clarity for a contractor of his/her IR35 status prior to a contract being signed so that appropriate rates can be negotiated.

Within IR35 status calculations:

Have sufficient allowances for expenses, particularly for travelling freelance contractors (rather than just 5% currently).

Exempt ENICs from the IR35 calculations, as regular employees do not pay ENICs.

Build sufficient allowances into the calculations to recognise a lack of employee benefits.

attributes.action: Hold another UK EU referendum in which UK residents can vote alongside Brits
attributes.background: The results of the UK EU referendum does not accurately reflect the wishes of the country and that is because UK residents were not granted a vote.  UK residents deserve to have a voice in the future of their country.
attributes.additional_details:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) Labour Force Survey estimated in 2015, there are 3.3 million EU citizens residing in the UK.

UK residents have been calling this country home for years.  They work here, pay taxes, have had children here, own property and yet they didn't have a say in the future of what is also their country.  

A new referendum must be held to include their voice.

attributes.action: change the law for sentences that reflect in loss of life to a family dog.
attributes.background: Our family dog was recently run over by a speeding motorbike. Our dog was on a lead and this only happened because the rider of the bike was speeding. The law classes dogs as a possession so the rider of the bike can not be sentenced for killing our dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Our dog was part of the family as i'm sure most dogs are. If someone runs a dog over and they are at fault then I believe they should be senented for killing the dog, what if next time it's a child? 
The law classes dog's as property like a T.V. if your T.V breaks you relace it, you can't just replace a dog with another as they become part of the family.

attributes.action: Establish that a child has a default right to equal contact with both parents.
attributes.background: Where there is no evidence to suggest that a child should be subject to a protection enquiry in accordance with s47 (1) of the Children Act 1989, the law should detail and confirm that every child has an automatic right to 50/50 contact with both their mother and father.
attributes.additional_details:
Right now there are people deliberately denying their ex-partners from having contact with their children, simply to be vindictive, or to be manipulative, or in order to establish a 'status quo'.
Court orders take too long to acquire; and without them, a Non Resident Parent is powerless. 
This petition asks that the government prevents harm, by determining that every child, who is not at risk, has the automatic right to equal contact with both parents at the point of a relationship breakdown.

attributes.action: Stop increasing settlement visa fees
attributes.background: While a political target is needed to control immigrant, it should be preventing new ones from coming in, or persuading foreign students not to stay, but please don't punish whom is already here, worked for a few years and paid their taxes.
attributes.additional_details: They may just bought their first house, had their first baby. Asking them to leave is like pulling young plants out of the pot they just get used to, how cruel! Family value is claimed embraced here, but Home Office is denying this value under the name of government. If you don't want somebody to be here, don't take them in; if you took them here, treat them fairly. Most people are born kind, but the evil side can turn up if they are treated unfairly, as a human nature.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for horse riders to take their horses on public roads
attributes.background: To prevent the death and well-being of horses on public roads. To reduce road rage between motorists and horse riders. Horses being on the road causes traffic which causes more accidents and road rage. When a horse deficates, this can become a hazard for motorists as it makes the road slippy.

attributes.action: Ban 'Fracking' (Hydraulic fracturing for shale gas) in the UK.
attributes.background: We the undersigned UK residents support a law that condems Hydraulic Fracturing (fracking) of shale gas deposits from UK land and the retrieval or sale of any gas that could be produced from such places. We demand investment in gas produced from anerobic deigestion of organic waste.
attributes.additional_details: Fracking involves drilling past the depth of the water table and injecting water, toxic and radioactive chemicals at high pressure into the rockbed. It is contaminates the water table which is part of the hydrologic cycle. It is environmentally unsustainable. 200 countries  have agreed to end the fossil fuel era. We are therefore asking this and future governments to support this agreement and ban hydraulic fractuing in the UK, investing in green gas instead.

attributes.action: Tougher legislation for manufacturers & retailers to reduce excessive packaging
attributes.background: The excessive unnecessary amount of packaging on products is disgusting. You can see it on  everything from food to vacuum cleaners. It is so wasteful and damaging to the environment, as well costly to local councils struggling to deal with the level of waste removal and re-cycling.

attributes.action: Automatically award the higher rate of PIP for all Cancer patients.
attributes.background: Cancer sufferers often have to forgo work when undergoing treatment, the impact of which is devastating for families already going through heartache and stress while juggling finances. Not everyone qualifies for ESA and are therefore left without financial assistance yet Cancer is very costly.
attributes.additional_details: Special Rules apply to those deemed by a medical professional likely to die within 6 months of diagnoses.  However no Cancer can be measured in this way. For example; other fatal complications could develop during treatment.  It's outrageous to expect sufferers to undergo the further stress of doing battle with complicated DWP forms when undergoing chemotherapy and is counter productive to recovery.  Cancer IS a special rule.

attributes.action: Qualifications of Health Professional for pip/wca medical to be openly available
attributes.background: I have had two assessment & when I asked for the details at the medical  I am qualified was the reply and a no was given from atos and dwp, we need to have the qualifications  of these health care professionals readily available/transparent to ensure that they are suitably experienced for the role.
attributes.additional_details: in view of the above statement, there are other evidence that has come to light ie a physiotherapist carrying out a pip assessment for bipolar, the second nurse that assessed me stated he was carrying out a mental health examination, however, when asked about his qualifications the only answer was I am qualified x4 , atos(employer) passed this to the dwp, the dwp stated that they have 5 weeks training   & refused as well, I & other's am concerned that they are not assessing to experience.

attributes.action: Make Kent eating disorders unit full time inpatient service again!
attributes.background: I was an inpatient at tulip house, Kent (eating disorders). The service has recently gone from 7day a week inpatient to 5day a week 9-5 service. This will cost lives! I cannot stress the importance of having a full time service. If it wasn't for my residential treatment there I would have died.
attributes.additional_details:
Eating disorders are a serious mental illness and have the highest mortality rates of all Psychiatric disorders. 

Please find more information in the following link:  https://www.b-eat.co.uk/about-beat/media-centre/information-and-statistics-about-eating-disorders 

Tulip house (Maidstone) is the ONLY eating disorders service in Kent. It is a NECESSARY service.

attributes.action: Bring all offshore tax havens subject to uk sovereignty under direct rule
attributes.background: That full disclosure be implemented on uk sovereignty territories with all tax avoidance entities and persons be prosecuted wherever financial illegalities are identified. That all recovered monies be invested in a uk national infrastructure investment bank

attributes.action: Call a general election immediately after Conservative party leadership decided
attributes.background: Labour & Conservatives contested the 2015 General Election with policies based on continuing EU membership.David Cameron has now resigned.The political landscape is now changed.Parties must devise new manifestos based on EU exit & transition & put to the electorate to decide who leads us through it.

attributes.action: Legalise holistic/complementary/alternative/therapeutic use of herbal cannabis.
attributes.background: Complementary/Alternative medicine is any practice that is put forward as having the healing effects of medicine in a belief not confirmed using the scientific method, and used together with conventional medicine it "complements" (improves the efficacy of) the treatment.Its use is evidence based.
attributes.additional_details: Herbal cannabis is used around the world as an alternative therapy and has been for millenia.In ancient times its versatility/low toxicity turned cannabis into the remedy of choice for common ailments of the masses.Its properties complement the efficacy of traditional Western Medicine.Intractable pain/MS/MND/insomnia/anti-cancer/anti-inflammatory/anti-nausea/anti-emetic/sedative/anti-anxiety/mood enhancer/antidepressant/appetite stimulant/dyspepsia/antispasmodic/anticonvulsant/bronchodilator.
